site.name: GOPROXY.IO
site.desc: A Global Proxy for Go Modules

comments: Set environment variable allow bypassing the proxy for selected modules
text: In Linux or macOS, you can execute the below commands.
Or, write it into the .bashrc or .bash_profile file.
In Windows, you can execute the below commands.
Now, when you build and run your applications, go will fetch dependencies via goproxy.io.
See more information in the goproxy repository.

If your Go version >= 1.13, the GOPRIVATE environment variable controls which modules the go command considers to be private (not available publicly) and should therefore not use the proxy or checksum database. For example:
